node.title: Sevens coaching legend Tietjens drops wisdom at world schools tournament
node.description: But the former NZ and Samoa mentor insists this is not a comeback.
node.content: ["The Grandmaster of Sevens - Sir Gordon Tiejens - wants to give back to the game he so dearly loves.", "\u201cIt's awesome to work with secondary school players,\u201d he tells Newshub. \u201cPlayers that love the game of sevens and aspire to go somewhere in the game of sevens.\u201d", "Sir Gordon is working with a NZ Asian Barbarians side as part of the 18-team World School Sevens tournament in Auckland this weekend and the legendary coach is still keen to get stuck in.", "\u201cIf you get a free kick and you go quickly, get away from the traffic,\u201d he tells his charges. \u201cThat's the idea of it - you attack the space, you tap and you go, and the guys go with him.", "\u201cReally quickly, then you'll reap the benefits.\u201d", "So, has this made the 66-year-old consider a return to the international scene?", "\u201cNo, no, certainly not,\u201d he insists. \u201cI've done my time.\u00a0", "\u201cI did 22 years with New Zealand and three years with Samoa. If I can get out there and help, if teams need that experience, then that's great.\u201d\u00a0\u00a0", "Tietjens is now committing time to another sport - he'll play at next week's senior tennis nationals at Tauranga.", "\u201cMate, I'm a lefty, so that's a strength in itself and I love serving.", "No doubt he'll continue to serve up plenty of knowledge for years to come."]
